intro: Delissea lauliiana, commonly known as the Lauliiana daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Delissea lauliiana is a rare species, often found in specific microhabitats on the islands of Oahu and Maui.
